meanings.definition: To strain to an excessive degree.
meanings.sent1: She overstrains her voice when she sings loudly.
meanings.sent2: He often overstrains his muscles by lifting heavy weights.
meanings.sent3: The little ant overstrains to carry a huge crumb.
meanings.sent4: Her determination overstrains her physical limits.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge creaks and groans as it overstrains under the weight of the truck.

meanings.definition: To put too much strain on something.
meanings.sent1: The weightlifter overstrains his back by attempting to lift too much.
meanings.sent2: Constantly overstraining the engine will lead to its early breakdown.
meanings.sent3: The chef overstrains the pasta, making it mushy and unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches overstrains under the weight of the heavy snow.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's coach warns him not to overstrains his injured knee during training.

meanings.definition: The act of straining too much.
meanings.sent1: Overstrains can lead to muscle injuries.
meanings.sent2: The overstrains on the rope caused it to snap.
meanings.sent3: The overstrains on the old chair made it collapse unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The overstrains on the relationship eventually caused it to break apart.
meanings.sent5: The overstrains on the bridge's support beams were evident in the cracks forming.
